p: In the group-to-group comparison, 3/47 (6.4%) lipids belonging to diacylglycerols (DAG) and triacylglycerols (TAG) were uniquely different between EV-A71-infected vs. mock-infected cells, 15/47 (31.9%) lipids belonging to SM, FFA, TAG, LPE, and EtherPE were uniquely different between CV-A16-infected vs. mock-infected cells, and 3/47 (6.4%) lipids belonging to EtherPE and PC were uniquely different between EV-A71-infected vs. CV-A16-infected cells ( Figure 3B). In addition, 15/47 (31.9%) lipids belonging to TAG, FFA, and LPC were significantly different in both EV-A71-infected and CV-A16-infected vs. mock-infected cells ( Figure 3B). Taken together, these results showed that the biogenesis of diverse intracellular lipids was significantly perturbed upon EV-A71 and CV-A16 infections.
